comment.text: The "FileCreated" translation key is used to display a message indicating when a file has been created. It appears in various contexts throughout the application, such as on buttons and dialogues related to file management. Translators should focus on localizing this phrase to provide a clear and intuitive experience for users.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Fişier a fost creat.' is not the most natural Romanian phrasing for 'File created.'. While technically correct, a more common and fluent translation would be 'Fișierul a fost creat.'
The translation 'ගොනුව සාදා ගන්නා ලදි' is overly verbose and doesn't directly translate 'File created.' It translates closer to 'File is being created.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion:
ගොනුව නිර්මාණය කරන ලදි (Gonu nirmanaya karana ladi) - File created/is being created.
Alternatively, a more concise option would be: ගොනුව නිර්මාණයයි (Gonu nirmanayai) - File created.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of 'ගන්නා' (gannā) in 'ගොනුව සාදා ගන්නා ලදි' is not typically used in this context.  'සාදා' (sādā) is sufficient to indicate creation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove 'ගන්නා' - Use 'ගොනුව සාදා ලදි' or 'ගොනුව සාදා ඇත'. However, both of these lack the continuous aspect present in the English.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Súbor vytvorený" is a passive construction that doesn't flow naturally in this context. A more natural phrasing would be "Vytvorený súbor." or "Nový súbor vytvorený."

The translation 'Датотека је креирана.' is a literal translation and sounds somewhat formal and clunky in Serbian. A more natural and common phrasing would be 'Фaјл је креиран.' or 'Направљенa дaтотекa.'
The translation 'Đã tạo các tập tin' is too general. 'File created' refers to a single file, not multiple files. 'Các tập tin' implies multiple files.
